Ekāsanadāyaka Thera：1．Ekāsanadāyaka Thera.-An arahant．In the time of Padumuttara Buddha he was an ascetic named Nārada-Kassapa，living near the mountain Kosika．Once he saw the Buddha walking through the forest，and having provided him with a seat，spoke words in praise of him．The Buddha preached to him a short sermon．Fifty times Ekāsanadāyaka became king of the gods and eighty times he ruled over men．Wherever he wished he could find a seat，even in the forest or in a river （Ap.ii.381f）.

2．Ekāsanadāyaka.-A Thera．In the time of Padumuttara，he，with his wife，left the deva-world，and coming amongst men waited upon a monk named Devala （Ap.i.226）.
